message.content:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: try {
    JarFile jar = new JarFile(jarFile);
    JarEntry entry = jar.getJarEntry(className + ".class");
    InputStream is = jar.getInputStream(entry);
    ByteArrayOutputStream byteStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
    int nextValue;
    while ((nextValue = is.read()) != -1) {
        byteStream.write(nextValue);
    }
    byte[] classByte = byteStream.toByteArray();
    Class<?> result = defineClass(className, classByte, 0, classByte.length, null);
    classes.put(className, result);
    return result;
} catch (Exception e) {
    throw new ClassNotFoundException(className + "Not found", e);
}
<<<explanation>>>: The InputStream.read() method is used here to read the bytes from the InputStream of the JarEntry. This is done in a loop until the end of the stream is reached (indicated by read() returning -1). These bytes are then written to a ByteArrayOutputStream. The resulting byte array is used to define a new class using the defineClass() method. This class is then cached in a Hashtable for future use. If the class cannot be found or an error occurs during this process, a ClassNotFoundException is thrown.
